name: HL7FHIRImplementationGuideClinicalGenomicsReportingSTU1
title: HL7 FHIR Implementation Guide: Clinical Genomics Reporting Release 1 | STU1
description: The Clinical Genomics Reporting FHIR IG is intended to standardize representation of genomics reporting to FHIR.

resource.name: Finding
resource.description: Properties common to genetic findings whose results are expressed as computable discrete elements (e.g. genotypes, haplotypes, variants, etc.).

resource.name: Genomic Implication
resource.description: Properties common to genetic implications expressed as computable discrete elements.

resource.name: Genomics specimen
resource.description: A sample to be used for analysis.

resource.name: Genomics base
resource.description: Base profile that defines characteristics shared by all genetic observations.

resource.name: Genomics service request
resource.description: Request that initiated the diagnostic report.

resource.name: Microsatellite instability
resource.description: Microsatellite instability (MSI) is the condition of genetic hypermutability (predisposition to mutation) that results from impaired DNA mismatch repair (MMR).

resource.name: Region Studied
resource.description: The Region Studied profile is used to assert actual regions studied for the performed test(s). Intended coverage areas may differ from actual coverage areas (e.g. due to technical limitations during test performance).

resource.name: Tumor Mutation Burden
resource.description: Definitions for the tmb resource profile. The total number of mutations (changes) found in the DNA of cancer cells. [Source: NCI Dictionary](https://www.cancer.gov/publications/dictionaries/cancer-terms/def/tumor-mutational-burden)

resource.name: Variant
resource.description: Details about a set of changes in the tested sample compared to a reference sequence.

resource.name: Related Artifact
resource.description: Captures citations, evidence and other supporting documentation for the observation or report.

resource.name: DNA Change Type
resource.description: DNA Change Type of a variant.

resource.name: Functional Annotation
resource.description: Functional annotation of a variant.

resource.name: HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee Gene Names (HGNC)
resource.description: This value set includes all HGNC Codes, which includes multiple code systems. In this guide, Gene IDs from HGNC are used as CodeableConcepts, which must be sent with the HGNC gene ID including the prefix 'HGNC:' as the code and the HGNC 'gene symbol' as display. CAUTION: HGNC also indexes gene groups by numeric ID (without a prefix), and older systems may send HGNC gene IDs without the prefix, so care must be taken to confirm alignment. We have separately included the genegroup code system to draw attention to this ambiguity and potential error.

resource.name: Human Genome Variation Society (HGVS) Nomenclature
resource.description: HGVS-nomenclature is used to report and exchange information regarding variants found in DNA, RNA and protein sequences and serves as an international standard. (source: varnomen.hgvs.org)

resource.name: High Low codes
resource.description: This value set includes high/low codes for Observation Interpretations

resource.name: TBD Value Set
resource.description: Value Set for codes yet to be defined in LOINC

resource.name: Variant Inheritance (FSH)
resource.description: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its origin.

resource.name: CGPatientExample01
resource.description: Example for Patient. Supports references to subject for multiple genomics reporting profile conforming instances.

resource.name: GenomicSpecimenExample01
resource.description: Example for Genomic Specimen

resource.name: Find Subject Variants
resource.description: Use this operation to retrieve variants with precise endpoints from a specified genomic region for a specified patient. If the range in question has been studied, the operation returns a FHIR Parameters resource containing variants overlapping the region. If the patient or the specified region has not been studied, the operation returns a 404 error.
